Metadata: Occurrence of the codling ("Halargyreus johnsonii", moridae), in the eastern North Pacific

This report documents the occurence of "Halargyreus johnsonii", a codling, caught 20 March 1990 during a study of catch composition in the northern California deep-water trawl fishery, and represents only the fourth recorded capture of "H. johnsonii" in the eastern North Pacific. The specimen was caught in a commercial bottom trawl at approximately 980 m depth 33 naut miles off the Klamath River.
